intro: Sphaerostephanos arfakianus, commonly known as the Arfakian starflower, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments, often in mountainous regions. Its leaves are lanceolate and arranged in a basal rosette, while its flowers are clustered in umbels. Sphaerostephanos arfakianus is noted for its ornamental value and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
